text: Nana Alexandria (, Nana Giorgis asuli Aleksandria; born 13 October 1949) is a Georgian chess Woman Grandmaster (1976) and International Arbiter (1995). She was the challenger in two matches for the Women's World Chess Championship. She is the mother of the Georgian politician Giga Bokeria. ==Career== Alexandria was awarded the Woman International Master (WIM) title in 1966 and the WGM title in 1976, she was USSR Women's Champion in 1966, 1968 (jointly) and 1969. Alexandria was the Women's World Championship Challenger in 1975 and 1981. In 1975 she lost to Nona Gaprindashvili (+3 =1 −8). In 1981 she drew with Maia Chiburdanidze (+4 =8 −4), with Chiburdanidze retaining her title as champion. Alexandria played for Soviet Union in the Chess Olympiads of 1969, 1974, 1978, 1980, 1982 and 1986.OlimpBase Women's Chess Olympiads Nana Alexandria She was one of the contributing players of the USSR team that dominated the women's Olympiads of the 1980s. Her best Elo rating was 2415 in 1988. Alexandria is now an administrator to FIDE. She was the chairperson of the FIDE Women's Commission from 1986 to 2001. ==Further reading== * * ChessBase News ==References== ==External links== * * Category:1949 births Category:Living people Category:People from Poti Category:Chess woman grandmasters Category:Female chess players from Georgia (country) Category:Soviet female chess players Category:Chess arbiters Category:Chess administrators
title: Nana Alexandria
